meanings.definition: To form into a tube or tubes.
meanings.sent1: She tried to tubulate the paper into a straw.
meanings.sent2: The factory workers tubulate the metal pipes for construction.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to tubulate the scarf into a magic wand.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar seemed to tubulate itself into a cocoon.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly to tubulate the clay into a vase.

meanings.definition: Having a tubular form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The tubulate plant stems stood tall in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The telescope has a tubulate shape for viewing distant stars.
meanings.sent3: The tubulate straw hat made him look like a detective.
meanings.sent4: The tubulate tunnels of the ant farm fascinated the children.
meanings.sent5: The tubulate body of the worm helped it move through the soil easily.
